name: Sefirot
shortDescription: Ten divine emanations through which God interacts with creation, forming the Tree of Life
fullDescription: The Sefirot (Hebrew: ×¡Ö°×¤Ö´×™×¨×•Ö¹×ª, singular Sefirah) are the ten divine emanations or attributes through which the infinite God (Ein Sof) reveals Himself and continuously creates both the physical and metaphysical universes. Described in Kabbalistic literature as the Tree of Life (Etz Chaim), the Sefirot represent different aspects of God's interaction with creation: Keter (Crown), Chokmah (Wisdom), Binah (Understanding), Chesed (Loving-kindness), Gevurah (Strength/Judgment), Tiferet (Beauty/Harmony), Netzach (Victory/Eternity), Hod (Glory/Splendor), Yesod (Foundation), and Malkhut (Kingdom/Sovereignty). An additional non-Sefirah called Da'at (Knowledge) sometimes appears between the upper three. The Sefirot are arranged in three pillarsâ€”right (mercy), left (severity), and center (balance)â€”and connected by 22 pathways corresponding to the Hebrew letters.

manifestations.description: The Sefirot originate in early Kabbalistic texts like the Sefer Yetzirah and are fully developed in the Zohar and later Lurianic Kabbalah. They represent the divine structure underlying all reality and the path of both divine descent (creation) and human ascent (spiritual development).
